image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Missouri; born in Sikeston, Scott County, Mo., May 22, 1958; graduated from Thomas W. Kelly High School, Benton, Mo.; B.S., University of Missouri, 1980; J.D., University of Mississippi Law School, 1983; assistant public defender, 1983-1986; assistant prosecuting attorney, Cape Girardeau, Mo., 1986-1989; assistant attorney general, Office of the Missouri state attorney general, 1989-1996; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2009); not a candidate for reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate for Governor of Missouri in 2008.

researchRecord.name: 1994, 4 commercials on 1 videocassette.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Kenny Hulshof's 1994 campaign for U.S. Congress in District 9 of Missouri, Republican Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: 1997-2009, approximately 227 boxes
researchRecord.description: The papers of Kenny Hulshof, an attorney and U.S. Representative, contain congressional papers from his time serving Missouriâ€™s 9th district from 1997-2009. The papers include subject files, committee files, constituent mail, schedules, photographs, audiovisual material, and some campaign material.

recordLocation.name: The State Historical Society of Missouri
